body: LGTM :)
@Nppatel97 can you please add screenshots so we can see as reviewers what the changes actually look like on the new page? thanks

Design-wise, I am very impressed with the way it looks. There are some design-inconsistencies that should be fixed before this is merged with master. 1- The email should be on a separate line to the email label to keep it consistent with the way the bio looks. 2- When you first refresh the page, you can see the information of all the tabs (Demonstrated in an attached picture), this is fixed once you actually click on a tab, but I think this should be fixed. Other than that, just look at the comments left by Shreyas and me.
LGTM once my other feedback is addressed 💯

@JeSuisAhmedN can you add the skills of the profiles so I can add them to this profile page under the pic? You can just add them to the back-end if possible and I will display them on the front using django for loops and stuff

![profilepage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22160794/44179556-a7870000-a0b4-11e8-82b1-02a1119973c5.PNG)

Here are the changes. I removed any unwanted code from all the 3 files (html, css and js). Changed the variable names to more descriptive ones in js file and made other changes you guys requested.

Let me know how this looks, I can make any other changes you like, otherwise I can go ahead and commit and merge.
@Nppatel97 The design looks very very good. I'll add the skills field in a commit on this branch.

Look of the my_profile page after adding skills to the backend. As of right now there is no way to add skills through schedulearn, however you can add skills through Django's admin system. To do that you need to create a super user, first 1 - in the terminal type: ``` $ python3 manage.py createsuperuser ``` then fill in the details to create a superuser. 2 - start the server and go to localhost:8000/admin/ 3- sign in using your superuser 4- Go to the skills table and and add a skill for a user from there Im gonna approve this pr now, LGTM
LGTM! Dark theme is dope!

I know right @Nppatel97 ! haha but yeah I personally really like the new look of these pages and I love when a change (like this PR) adds value but the net # of lines of code is actually a code removal ❤️
I'll update the CSS files, will look into the html user picture code again

Thanks for the suggestion @AhmedNSidd I think that could be a good idea. I don't think it should be a merge blocker so will merge this for now and we can definitely re-iterate on the text wording/design if and when we need 👍

@AhmedNSidd awesome work on this, although it seems like a lot of comments (i wanted to be clear in my feedback) it actually isn't much - so once you make the necessary changes I think we are ready for an LGTM 👍
This looks pretty good. Once all changes mentioned by @sdevalapurkar are made it will be good to merge. I can work on them and add to this PR
## Updated look of the agenda page ## Updated look of the relationships page Edit: ## Updated look of the choose_person page After addressing @sdevalapurkar's comments
New photo looks great :shipit:
Looking very clean thanks Nisarg! I personally think the profile page elements should be centered, what do you guys think?

> Looking very clean thanks Nisarg! I personally think the profile page elements should be centered, what do you guys think?

I agree I think they might look good if centered. However, I don't think this is a blocker - I think we should get this merged and shipped 🚢 :shipit: as soon as possible
@Nppatel97 please ensure all the merge conflicts are cleanly resolved prior to merge

Thank @DSchriemer and @sdevalapurkar for the comments! Yeah the profile page will look much better when centered, I'll work on it. There is major code clean up in progress so the code will looks way better than this with any redundancy removed. I'll also solve all conflicts before merge.
@Nppatel97 what's the status on this PR? if possible, let's get the merge conflicts resolved cleanly and then proceed with these changes
@Nppatel97 what happens if you remove that `endif` completely?? Looks like it might be an extra tag

I think it will be a good idea to completely remove this PR. There are conflicts, messed up Django codes and overlapping UIs everywhere. Code looks pretty messy... I have a backup of the entire mobile redesign which I can use to recreate this PR, it will take much less time to do that rather than solving this current PR. Thoughts? What should I do?
P.S. Really sorry for messing this PR up bad :( I should've been more careful in dealing with the conflicts.
sure thing, ill close this Pull request and let you get new changes up and open a different brand new PR @Nppatel97

great work on this, this is a huge PR and a lot of changes! I have added the work in progress label to the PR so just remove it once feedback is addressed and you feel like the PR is fully ready for another round of review (at which point I will review it again 👀)

I will make the requested changes to the html/css files. For js files, I'm not sure what the code does so I'd suggest @AhmedNSidd to make changes to JS or we can work together on them. Thanks for feedback, more changes on the way

Sorry on running a little late. I've made another commit that addresses most of the above feedbacks. For the JS files, I think I should work with you guys or one of you should make the changes as I don't want to mess up any code. There may be some little UI issues here and there (like the notification pane mentioned by @AhmedNSidd etc.) and I am working on fixing them. Let me know if I missed something and I'll try my best to get it fixed ASAP. 

Also, at this point, I think this PR for mobile re-design looks clean enough to be pushed to master. The little UI bugs I mentioned are not a big deal and the functionality of any features isn't affected as far as I know. If y'all feel like this PR is ready then feel free to merge it, I'll create another one to make additional changes that I am working on.
I have addressed many of the changes mentioned in this PR. There remain some few though, and I think we should address them in another PR.
Issue Resolved: had to recollect staticfiles on VPS
